channel.title: Someone make a real RSC server
channel.description:
Seriously these private servers are a joke make a EXACT replica with an Auction House and 1x exp.
THATS ALL why wont anyone do this?
~K!zL

item.title: Someone make a real RSC server
item.dc:creator: @RSCRevolution RSCRevolution
item.description:
@RSCRevolution wrote:

Sumiagaming:

I’d pay for host and setup a server identical to RSC. If alone their was a decent base core and people interested to spend all their spare hours a day coding.

http://www.rscrevolution.com/

or our mopar thread

https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,661275.0.html

We almost done replicating the whole game. We have a solid team. Only problem in the RSC business is the funds as people ddos hard but so far so good with the funds. Your support is always welcome as this project will be the closest replica you will have played.

We are opening the servers very soon so stay tuned.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone make a real RSC server
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

burger1990:

not too sure, but the owner of rscdedication signed a 1 year contract n i think someone said hes paying like 110-120 a month. i dont know if thats cheap cause hes in a contract or if thats expensive, or if its even the truth LOL.

That’s only the dedicated server, for the ddos protection you must pay around 5-8 times that on top of it. And DDoS protection is a must have for popular servers, otherwise the script kiddies in this community will ddos u down.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone make a real RSC server
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“AlCoHoLiC, post:9, topic:541288”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=660162.msg4415912#msg4415912 date=1395899762]
How old are you? How much time do you have, day in day out, to dedicate to the game?
Unless you’re a NEET, or a kid, the answer will likely be ‘not much’.

1x servers don’t attract substantial interest because progress is too slow. As I’ve said elsewhere before, there needs to be a balance between experience rate and play time such that even the casual players can get to the enjoyable portion of the game.

This could take many forms. A rest system that, based on time logged out, awards bonus experience.

Or perhaps a paradigm whereby the server operates on ‘seasons’ - experience rate is highish, but the game is restarted after the conclusion of each season. The advantage with this approach is twofold: People aren’t automatically turned off due to feeling like they’ve ‘missed the boat’ (as a latecomer), and you can experiment with features between seasons.
[/quote]

People made an account on RSC to play the game, no one thought have I got time to level to 99 faster then anyone else no one did that. Private servers have fked peoples perception of what RSC was with high XP rates and party hats all over the place… People make servers now for people to reach Max everything in a few weeks there is zero point in a RSC server if everyone has maxed out identical stats rsc wasn’t like this.[/quote]
If you think is maxing in weeks are bad, come to 317+. They have like 800x exp rates where you can max the first day…

Read full topic
item.source: Someone make a real RSC server

item.title: Someone make a real RSC server
item.dc:creator: @AlCoHoLiC AlCoHoLiC
item.description:
@AlCoHoLiC wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:7, topic:541288”]How old are you? How much time do you have, day in day out, to dedicate to the game?
Unless you’re a NEET, or a kid, the answer will likely be ‘not much’.

1x servers don’t attract substantial interest because progress is too slow. As I’ve said elsewhere before, there needs to be a balance between experience rate and play time such that even the casual players can get to the enjoyable portion of the game.

This could take many forms. A rest system that, based on time logged out, awards bonus experience.

Or perhaps a paradigm whereby the server operates on ‘seasons’ - experience rate is highish, but the game is restarted after the conclusion of each season. The advantage with this approach is twofold: People aren’t automatically turned off due to feeling like they’ve ‘missed the boat’ (as a latecomer), and you can experiment with features between seasons.[/quote]

People made an account on RSC to play the game, no one thought have I got time to level to 99 faster then anyone else no one did that. Private servers have fked peoples perception of what RSC was with high XP rates and party hats all over the place… People make servers now for people to reach Max everything in a few weeks there is zero point in a RSC server if everyone has maxed out identical stats rsc wasn’t like this.

Read full topic
item.source: Someone make a real RSC server

item.title: Someone make a real RSC server
item.dc:creator: @sklem sklem
item.description:
@sklem wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:7, topic:541288”]How old are you? How much time do you have, day in day out, to dedicate to the game?
Unless you’re a NEET, or a kid, the answer will likely be ‘not much’.

1x servers don’t attract substantial interest because progress is too slow. As I’ve said elsewhere before, there needs to be a balance between experience rate and play time such that even the casual players can get to the enjoyable portion of the game.[/quote]
+1
We all know that you need quite a few bucks to keep a server running. I will bring an example from totally different field but in my opinion it makes sense.

I am sure that most of you are familiar with women having free entrance to the clubs. Seems like clubs need more women to the clubs.
NO. These women are not the usual customers for clubs. They usually don’t buy drinks, instead they find someone to buy for them (ofc. there are exceptions). So what the clubs do is grant free entrance for women who attract people who bring money in.

1x exp server is for those who can spend all their time on gaming. Those who have jobs have basically no possibilities to compete with the others. However these people who can spend all day on gaming will probably play higher exp rate servers too.

Read full topic
item.source: Someone make a real RSC server

item.title: Someone make a real RSC server
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

How old are you? How much time do you have, day in day out, to dedicate to the game?
Unless you’re a NEET, or a kid, the answer will likely be ‘not much’.

1x servers don’t attract substantial interest because progress is too slow. As I’ve said elsewhere before, there needs to be a balance between experience rate and play time such that even the casual players can get to the enjoyable portion of the game.

This could take many forms. A rest system that, based on time logged out, awards bonus experience.

Or perhaps a paradigm whereby the server operates on ‘seasons’ - experience rate is highish, but the game is restarted after the conclusion of each season. The advantage with this approach is twofold: People aren’t automatically turned off due to feeling like they’ve ‘missed the boat’ (as a latecomer), and you can experiment with features between seasons.

Read full topic
item.source: Someone make a real RSC server
